conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph of object B.
The graph shows the velocity v as a function of time t for two objects, A and B. The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration.
We need to analyze the slope of the graph for object B to determine its acceleration.
The slope of the velocity-time graph is the acceleration. A positive slope indicates positive acceleration, and a negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
For object B, the graph shows that the slope is negative initially (from t = 0 to t = t1).
The negative slope from t = 0 to t = t1 indicates negative acceleration.
The slope of the graph for object B becomes zero at t = t1.
The zero slope at t = t1 indicates that the acceleration is zero at this point.
The slope of the graph for object B is positive after t = t1 (from t = t1 to t = t2).
The positive slope from t = t1 to t = t2 indicates positive acceleration.
From t = 0 to t = t1, the acceleration is negative; at t = t1, the acceleration is zero; from t = t1 to t = t2, the acceleration is positive.
The trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2 is negative to zero to positive.
The final answer is negative to zero to positive.
